newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austrian insolvencies fall sharply in Jan-May 1997.
newsitem.headline: Austrian insolvencies fall sharply in Jan-May 1997.

text.p: The number of Austrian insolvencies and the liabilities of insolvent firms declined drastically in the first five months of the year, the Austrian creditor protection agency said on Wednesday.

Liabilities fell to 12.9 billion schillings from 34.5 billion in the same period last year, the agency said in a statement. The overall number of insolvencies declined to 1,991 from 2,489 in the year-ago period, it added. -- Vienna newsroom, +431 53112 274
